text: The North New Town Historic District, in Las Vegas, New Mexico, is a historic district which was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1983. The district included 225 contributing buildings in a area, about 15 city blocks. The area runs roughly from National to Friedman, and form the alley between 2nd and 3rd to the alley between 8th and 9th Streets in Las Vegas. It includes Bungalow/craftsman, Late Victorian, and Free Classic architecture. title: North New Town Historic District
